001package org.biopax.validator;
002
003
004import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
005import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
006import org.biopax.paxtools.io.SimpleIOHandler;
007import org.biopax.paxtools.model.Model;
008import org.biopax.paxtools.normalizer.Normalizer;
009import org.biopax.validator.api.Validator;
010import org.biopax.validator.api.ValidatorUtils;
011import org.biopax.validator.api.beans.Validation;
012import org.biopax.validator.api.beans.ValidatorResponse;
013import org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext;
014import org.springframework.context.support.ClassPathXmlApplicationContext;
015import org.springframework.core.io.Resource;
016import org.springframework.util.ResourceUtils;
017
018import javax.xml.transform.Source;
019import javax.xml.transform.stream.StreamSource;
020import java.io.*;
021import java.util.Collection;
022import java.util.HashSet;
023import java.util.Set;
024
025/**
026 * PC BioPAX Validator (console), which
027 * checks from the user input or a "batch" file.
028 * <p>
029 * See: README.txt, context.xml, messages.properties
030 *
031 * @author rodche
032 */
033public class Main {
034  static final Log log = LogFactory.getLog(Main.class);
035  static ApplicationContext ctx;
036  static boolean autofix = false;
037  static int maxErrors = 0;
038  static final String EXT = ".modified.owl";
039  static String profile = null;
040  static String xmlBase = null;
041  static String outFormat = "html";
042  static String output = null;
043
044  public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
045
046    if (args == null || args.length == 0) {
047      log.warn("At least input file/dir must be specified.");
048      printHelpAndQuit();
049    }
050
051    String input = args[0];
052
053    if (input == null || input.isEmpty() || input.startsWith("--")) {
054      log.warn("Input (file, url, or directory) is probably missing");
055      printHelpAndQuit();
056    }
057
058    // match optional parameters
059    for (int i = 1; i < args.length; i++) {
060      if ("--auto-fix".equalsIgnoreCase(args[i])) {
061        autofix = true;
062      } else if (args[i].startsWith("--max-errors=")) {
063        String n = args[i].substring(13);
064        maxErrors = Integer.parseInt(n);
065      } else if (args[i].startsWith("--profile=")) {
066        profile = args[i].substring(10);
067      } else if (args[i].startsWith("--xmlBase=")) {
068        xmlBase = args[i].substring(10);
069      } else if (args[i].startsWith("--output=")) {
070        output = args[i].substring(9);
071      } else if (args[i].startsWith("--out-format=")) {
072        outFormat = args[i].substring(13);
073        if (outFormat.isEmpty())
074          outFormat = "html";
075      }
076    }
077
078    // this does 90% of the job ;)
079    ctx = new ClassPathXmlApplicationContext(
080      "META-INF/spring/appContext-loadTimeWeaving.xml",
081      "META-INF/spring/appContext-validator.xml");
082    // Rules are now loaded, and AOP is listening for BioPAX model method calls.
083
084    // get the beans to work with
085    Validator validator = (Validator) ctx.getBean("biopaxValidator");
086
087    // go validate all
088    runBatch(validator, getResourcesToValidate(input));
089  }
090
091
092  private static void printHelpAndQuit() {
093    final String usage =
094      "\nThe BioPAX Validator v3\n\n" +
095        "Usage (arguments):\n <input> [--output=<filename>] [--out-format=xml|html] [--auto-fix] " +
096        "[--xmlBase=<base>] [--max-errors=<n>] [--profile=notstrict]\n\n" +
097        "Given --output=<filename>, a one-file validation report will be \n" +
098        "generated (HTML or XML) instead of default report file(s) in the \n" +
099        "current directory. Optional arguments can go in any order.\n" +
100        "For example:\n" +
101        "  path/dir --out-format=xml\n" +
102        "  list:batch_file.txt --output=reports.html\n" +
103        "  file:biopax.owl --out-format=xml --auto-fix\n" +
104        "  http://www.some.net/data.owl\n\n" +
105        "A batch file should list one task (resource) per line, i.e.,\n" +
106        "file:path/file or URL (to BioPAX data)\n" +
107        "If '--auto-fix' option was used, it also creates a new BioPAX file \n" +
108        "for each input file in the current working directory \n" +
109        "(adding '.modified.owl' exention). If the outFormat file extension \n" +
110        "is '.html', the XML result will be auto-transformed to a stand-alone \n" +
111        "HTML/javascript page, which is very similar to what the online version returns.";
112    System.out.println(usage);
113    System.exit(-1);
114  }
115
116
117  protected static void runBatch(Validator validator,
118                                 Collection<Resource> resources) throws IOException {
119
120    //collect all reports in this object (only if --output option was used)
121    final ValidatorResponse consolidatedReport = new ValidatorResponse();
122
123    // Read from the batch and validate from file, id or url, line-by-line (stops on first empty line)
124    for (Resource resource : resources) {
125      Validation result = new Validation(new BiopaxIdentifier(), resource.getDescription(),
126        autofix, null, maxErrors, profile);
127      result.setDescription(resource.getDescription());
128      log.info("BioPAX DATA IMPORT FROM: " + result.getDescription());
129      try {
130        validator.importModel(result, resource.getInputStream());
131        validator.validate(result);
132
133        //if autofix is enabled, then do normalize too
134        if (autofix) {
135          Model model = (Model) result.getModel();
136          Normalizer normalizer = new Normalizer();
137          normalizer.setXmlBase(xmlBase); //if xmlBase is null, the model's one is used
138          normalizer.normalize(model);
139        }
140
141        if (output != null)
142          consolidatedReport.addValidationResult(result);
143
144      } catch (Exception e) {
145        log.error("failed", e);
146      }
147
148      final String filename = outFileName(result);
149      PrintWriter writer;
150
151      // save modified (normalized) biopax if the option was used
152      if (autofix) {
153        Model model = (Model) result.getModel();
154        (new SimpleIOHandler()).convertToOWL(model, new FileOutputStream(filename + EXT));
155      }
156
157      // remove the BioPAX data before writing report
158      result.setModel(null);
159      result.setModelData(null);
160
161      // save the individual validation results
162      //unless the user specified the output file explicitly
163      if (output == null || output.isEmpty()) {
164        writer = new PrintWriter(filename + ".validation." + outFormat);
165        Source xsltSrc = (outFormat.equalsIgnoreCase("html"))
166          ? new StreamSource(ctx.getResource("classpath:html-result.xsl").getInputStream())
167          : null;
168        ValidatorUtils.write(result, writer, xsltSrc);
169        writer.close();
170      }
171
172      validator.getResults().remove(result);
173      log.info("Done with " + filename);
174    }
175
176    // save if the user specified the output file explicitly
177    if (output != null) {
178      Writer writer = new PrintWriter(output);
179      Source xsltSrc = (outFormat.equalsIgnoreCase("html"))
180        ? new StreamSource(ctx.getResource("classpath:html-result.xsl").getInputStream())
181        : null;
182      ValidatorUtils.write(consolidatedReport, writer, xsltSrc);
183      writer.close();
184    }
185  }
186
187
188  private static String outFileName(Validation result) {
189    String filename = result.getDescription();
190    // if was URL, create a shorter name;
191    // remove ']', '[', and ending '/', if any
192    filename = filename.replaceAll("\\[|\\]", "").replaceFirst("/&", "");
193    int idx = filename.lastIndexOf('/');
194    if (idx >= 0) {
195      if (idx < filename.length() - 1)
196        filename = filename.substring(idx + 1);
197    }
198
199    return filename;
200  }
201
202
203  public static Collection<Resource> getResourcesToValidate(String input) throws IOException {
204    Set<Resource> setRes = new HashSet<Resource>();
205
206    File fileOrDir = new File(input);
207    if (fileOrDir.isDirectory()) {
208      // validate all the OWL files in the folder
209      FilenameFilter filter = new FilenameFilter() {
210        public boolean accept(File dir, String name) {
211          return (name.endsWith(".owl"));
212        }
213      };
214      for (String s : fileOrDir.list(filter)) {
215        String uri = "file:" + fileOrDir.getCanonicalPath() + File.separator + s;
216        setRes.add(ctx.getResource(uri));
217      }
218    } else if (input.startsWith("list:")) {
219      // consider it's a file that contains a list of (pseudo-)URLs
220      String batchFile = input.replaceFirst("list:", "file:");
221      Reader isr = new InputStreamReader(ctx.getResource(batchFile).getInputStream());
222      BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(isr);
223      String line;
224      while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null && !"".equals(line.trim())) {
225        // check the source URL
226        if (!ResourceUtils.isUrl(line)) {
227          log.error("Invalid URL: " + line +
228            ". A resource must be either a " +
229            "pseudo URL (classpath: or file:) or standard URL!");
230          continue;
231        }
232        setRes.add(ctx.getResource(line));
233      }
234      reader.close();
235    } else {
236      // a single local OWL file or remote data
237      Resource resource = null;
238      if (!ResourceUtils.isUrl(input))
239        input = "file:" + input;
240      resource = ctx.getResource(input);
241      setRes.add(resource);
242    }
243
244    return setRes;
245  }
246}
